p: In this study, the extracts and EO of P. linearis were evaluated for in vitro α-amylase activity. As indicated in Table 4, the EO inhibited the enzyme’s activity by 25.7% at concentration of 10 mg/mL. The following order of the extracts against α-amylase activity was observed at 10 mg/mL concentration: n-hexane (31.5 ± 2.6%), methanol (30.5 ± 1.4), diethyl ether (28.3 ± 4.0%) and ethyl acetate (24.8 ± 2.0%). It should be noted that acarbose displayed more potent inhibition of α-amylase (57.2%, concentration at 0.25 mg/mL) than all tested extracts and EO.
